courses: PhD Thesis: Surrogate-Assisted Evolutionary Algorithms for Computationally Expensive Optimization Problems

Research interests: Machine Learning and Optimisation, including deep learning, transfer learning, Bayesian optimisation, evolutionary computation, statistical learning, stochastic processes, and their applications in real-world problems.

Work Experience.name: Department of Economics, University of Warwick
highlights: Scraping high-dimensional, complex data from 425 idiosyncratic online platforms via deploying scrapers on AWS.

Work Experience.name: Ford Motor Company
highlights: Processed and analyzed large real-world motor engine datasets to uncover intrinsic patterns from the data.
Applied machine learning techniques (e.g. deep learning) and statistical learning techniques (e.g. Gaussian Processes) to develop predictive models for motor engines.
Developed intelligent model-based optimisation / Bayesian optimisation algorithms to calibrate gasoline motor engines.

Work Experience.name: Learning And Mining from DatA (LAMDA) Group, Nanjing University
highlights: Research topics: Machine Learning, Statistical Learning, Bayesian Optimisation
Developed a co-training semi-supervised regression approach to actively learn predictive models for problems.

Projects[None].name: Quantum Computing
Projects[None].summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.

Publications.name: FSEO: Few-Shot Evolutionary Optimization via Meta-Learning for Expensive Multi-Objective Optimization
Publications.publisher: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 39 (NeurIPS'25)
